description: Demolition of existing warehouse building (Class B8) and construction of  a four storey building including carparking at basement level, commercial units (Class B1) at ground and first floors and 13 residential (Class C3) units at second and third floors.
decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted must be begun not later than the end of three years from the date of this permission.

Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).

Condition : 2 - Sample panels of all facing materials shall be submitted for approval prior to commencement of construction of the approved development:

An approved sample panel shall be provided on site and the development shall be carried out in accordance with the approval of materials given.  The sample panel shall be retained on site until the development has been completed.

Reason: To safeguard the appearance of the premises and the character of the immediate area in accordance with the requirements of policies B1, B3 and B7 of the London Borough of Camden Replacement Unitary Development Plan 2006.

Condition : 4 - Details demonstrating how the area shown on the approved plans as providing cycle storage will provide for not less than 18 bicycles shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  The approved cycle storage shall be provided in its entirety prior to the occupation of the building and retained permanently thereafter for the storage of cycles only.

Reason: To ensure adequate provision of cycle storage in accordance with the requirements of policy T3 of the London Borough of Camden Replacement Unitary Development Plan 2006.

Condition : 5 - A construction methodology statement plus accompanying drawings shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before works on site commence.  Once approved, the methodology shall be in force for the duration of the works until completion.  Reason: To ensure that any obstruction of the surrounding streets is avoided and mitigated for the duration of the construction period, in accordance with policy T12 of the London Borough of Camden Replacement Unitary Development Plan 2006.

Condition : 6 - Prior to the occupation of the development, a servicing strategy for the employment space shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  The development shall be serviced in accordance with the approved strategy, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Reason:  To ensure that the servicing of the employment space would not result in any disruption or harm to highway safety, in accordance with policy T16 of the London Borough of Camden Replacement Unitary Development Plan 2006.

Condition : 7 - The refuse and recycle stores shown on the approved plans shall be provided before any part of the building is occupied and thereafter shall remain permanently available for the storage of refuse and recyclable materials only.  Reason:  In the interests of visual amenity, highway safety and to encourage energy conservation through recycling, in accordance with policies S1, S2 and SD6 of the London Borough of Camden Replacement Unitary Development Plan 2006.

Condition : 8 - No refuse associated with the development shall be stored outside of the building, other than on designated days of collection.  Reason: In the interests of visual amenity and highway safety, in accordance with policies S1, S2 and SD6 of the London Borough of Camden Replacement Unitary Development Plan 2006.

Condition : 9 - Noise levels at a point 1 metre external to sensitive facades shall be at least 5dB(A) less than the existing background measurement (LA90), expressed in dB(A) when all plant/equipment are in operation unless the plant/equipment hereby permitted will have a noise that has a distinguishable, discrete continuous note (whine, hiss, screech, hum) and/or if there are distinct impulses (bangs, clicks, clatters, thumps), then the noise levels from that piece of plant/equipment at any sensitive faï¿½ade shall be at least 10dB(A) below the LA90, expressed in dB(A).


Reason: To safeguard the amenities of the [adjoining] premises and the area generally in accordance with the requirements of policies SD6, SD7B, SD8 and Appendix 1 of the London Borough of Camden Replacement Unitary Development Plan 2006.

Condition : 10 - No development shall take place until full details of hard and soft landscaping and means of enclosure of all un-built, open areas have been submitted to and approved by the Council. Such details shall include details of any proposed earthworks including grading, mounding and other changes in ground levels. 

Reason: To enable the Council to ensure a reasonable standard of visual amenity in the scheme in accordance with the requirements of policies B1 and N8 of the London Borough of Camden Replacement Unitary Development Plan 2006.

Condition : 11 - Details of the sedum roofs, including species, planting density, substrate and a section at scale 1:20 showing that adequate depth is available in terms of the construction and long-term viability of the green roof, and a programme for a scheme of maintenance, shall be submitted to and approved by the Council prior to the commencement of works. Thereafter, the green roof shall be fully provided in accordance with the approved details, and permanently retained and maintained in accordance with the approved scheme of maintenance.   

Reason: To ensure that the green roof is suitably designed and maintained in accordance with the requirements of policies SD9 and B1 of the London Borough of Camden Replacement Unitary Development Plan 2006 and design advice in the Council's Supplementary Planning Guidance

Condition : 12 - The ground and first floor windows (employment space) to the north-east facing elevation of the building hereby permitted shall be fixed shut and glazed with obscure glass at the time of installation.  The windows shall be retained as such thereafter, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Reason:  To ensure that the use of the rear gardens to properties on Rochester Road would not be impeded, in accordance with policy SD6 of the London Borough of Camden Replacement Unitary Development Plan 2006.

Condition : 13 - No development shall take place until: a) The applicant has submitted a programme of ground investigation for the presence of soil and groundwater contamination and landfill gas for approval by the Council; and b) The investigation has been carried out in accordance with the approved details and the results and remediation measures (if necessary) have been submitted to and approved by the Council. All approved remediation measures shall be implemented strictly in accordance with the approved details.

Reason: To protect future occupiers of the development from the possible presence of ground contamination arising in connection with the previous industrial/storage use of the site in accordance with policy SD10B of the London Borough of Camden Replacement Unitary Development Plan 2006.

Condition : 14 - A method statement including details of the design of building foundations and the layout, with dimensions and levels, of service trenches and other excavations on site in so far as these items may affect protected trees at the rear of properties on Rochester Road and Wilmot Place, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by Local Planning Authority before any works on site are commenced.  The development shall be carried out with accordance with the details thereby approved, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

Reason: To ensure that the Council may be satisfied that the development will not have an adverse effect on existing trees and in order to maintain the character and amenities of the area in accordance with the requirements of policies N8 of the London Borough of Camden Replacement Unitary Development Plan 2006.

Condition : 15 - The areas shown on the plans to be planted as green roofs (as shown on dwg 23 of Public Realm Views document) shall be used for this purpose only and shall not be used as amenity space for either the employment or residential space, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Reason:  To encourage biodiversity and sustainable drainage and to enable an assessment as to whether the use of these areas for amenity purposes would result in unacceptable levels of overlooking to neighbouring habitable windows, in accordance with policies N5 and SD6 of the London Borough of Camden Replacement  Unitary Development Plan 2006.

Condition : 16 - The garden walls to the rear of properties on Rochester Road and Wilmot Place which abut the application site shall be rebuilt to match the existing and shall, as far as practicable, re-use the existing bricks.  Reason:  In order to preserve the character and appearance of this part of the Rochester Conservation Area, in accordance with policy B7 of the London Borough of Camden Replacement Unitary Development Plan 2006.

Condition : 17 - The car parking area shown on the approved plans shall be completed before the development hereby approved is occupied and thereafter, shall be kept free of obsruction and available for the parking of vehicles associated with the development.  Reason:  To ensure that there are adequate parking facilities to serve the development, in accordance with policy T9 of the London Borough of Camden Replacement Unitary Development Plan 2006.

Condition : 18 - Notwithstanding the information shown on the approved plans, the ground floor shall be constructed with minimum ceiling heights of 3.1m at ground floor level and 2.9m at first floor level.

Reason:  To ensure that the commercial space hereby permitted could be occupied by a flexible range of users, in accordance with policies E2 and E3 of the London Borough of Camden Replacement Unitary Development Plan 2006.

Condition : 19 - Notwithstanding the details shown on the approved plans, details of the goods lifts achieving a minimum size of 1.4mwide x 1.6m deep x 2m high shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to the commencement of development.  The development shall be carried out in accordance with the detail thereby approved, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

Reason:  To ensure that the commercial space hereby permitted could be occupied by a flexible range of users, in accordance with policies E2 and E3 of the London Borough of Camden Replacement Unitary Development Plan 2006.

Condition : 20 - Prior to the commencement of development, a detailed refuse strategy for the entire building including location of storage and method of collection shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  The development shall be carried out in accordance with the detail thereby approved, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

Reason:  In order to ensure that adequate space has been allocated within the development for the safe storage and collection of refuse, in accordance with policy SD6 of the London Borough of Camden Replacement Unitary Development Plan 2006 and Camden Planning Guidance 2006.
site_name: Former Site At 26-28 And 7 Rochester Mews
